newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bilfinger - H1 profit good, sees output up.
newsitem.headline: Bilfinger - H1 profit good, sees output up.

text.p: German construction group Bilfinger + Berger AG said on Thursday its earnings were satisfactory overall in the first six months of 1997 and that it expected construction output to rise four percent to 9.6 billion marks in the full year.
Bilfinger said in a statement that despite the recession plaguing the domestic building sector, earnings overall remained satisfactory.
"We expect that our annual results will match the quality of the previous year," Bilfinger said.
It predicted construction output would rise four percent to 9.6 billion marks from 9.2 billion marks in 1997 after rising 14 percent to 4.7 billion marks in the first six months.
Incoming orders in the period fell two percent to 4.44 billion marks, with a seven percent decline in domestic orders to 1.61 billion and a two percent rise in foreign orders to 2.83 billion marks.
Bilfinger said it expected domestic orders to keep falling in the second half while foreign orders should remain good.
